title: [IOTDB-2043] refactor: remove haveSorted param from Session
body:
## Description
For some methods in Session, we have a haveSorted parameter to indicate whether multi records are in ascending order of time.

This parameter is useless, we could check this by ourselves.
(1) checkSorted
(2) if not sorted, we could sort it.

## What
1. Delete `haveSorted` param in `insertRecordsOfOneDevice, insertAlignedRecordsOfOneDevice`. Since currently there are two overloaded version of `insertRecordsOfOneDevice, insertAlignedRecordsOfOneDevice` and they only differ in `haveSorted` param, so I merged two overloaded version into a single interface
2. Change the caller usages of above methods

title: [IOTDB-2083] ID table implementation
body:
## Description

### ID table
For mass timeseries, we need a new module to improve the performance and save memory space. This PR create a new module called id table which has two main optimization:
(1) Data ingestion schema check can be done through 2 steps of hash without mmanager tree-like structure
(2) Compress device path to id (can be configured to plain or sha256) and reuse it in both id table and memetable

### JIRA
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-2083

### Design doc
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=195727793

### Performance test
https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=199528283

-->

title: [IOTDB-2171, To Rel/0.12] Check the timeseries legitimacy when create timeseries
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-2171

Performance Test:
create 1 million timeseries in one session client, calculate the total cost time.

Testing environment:
macOS
The time unit is milliseconds


 | 1000000 | 100000 | 10000
-- | -- | -- | --
new | 54835 | 6274 | 1186
old | 46704 | 5270 | 1118

From the test result, we can see that the new version will be slower than the old version, which also makes sense because, in this pr, we use antlr to check the grammar, which will cost more time.  However, the benefit is that when we check ourselves we always miss some situations and are inaccurate but antlr can ensure this.

Any ideas about this?

title: [IOTDB-2154]add TsFileUtils.isTsFileComplete
body:
## Description
Issue-2154
Add TsFileUtils.isTsFileComplete Method to check whether a TsFile is complete

Currently, we use RestorableTsFileIOWriter to check whether a TsFile is complete. However it will scan the TsFile and return truncate size if it is broken. We also need to remember to close the writer after doing the check. 
Sometimes we just need a simple method to determine whether a TsFile is complete, (by complete, only if the head magic and tail magic string exists.)

In this PR, I extract the code of deciding completeness from RestorableTsFileIOWriter and uses TsFileSequenceReader.isComplete internally

title: Rethrow other exceptions in query main thread
body:
## Description

Currently, if the sub thread throw an Error like `OutOfMemoryError`, the main thread won't exit, it will blocked on the `take` operation of `BlockingQueue`.

## Solution

Anytime we got the `ExceptionBatchData`, we should rethrow it.

title: [IOTDB-2144][Metric] Collect IoTDB Runtime Metrics
body:
## Description
Benefit from the metric framework, we could now collect some core IoTDB Runtime metrics, which will help users get a clear sight of their IoTDB's status and will also help RD an SRE resolve problems or establish their own monitor systems.
1. These metrics will coverage current core modules, such as clusterflushthriftcompactioncacheJVMlogback...
2. All metrics will provided with both standard JMX via JMX beans and Prometheus format via http APIs.

jira:

title: Fix connection refused using session when users forget to set client ip
body:
Users only set internal ip in iotdb-cluster.properties, and they often forget to set the rpc_address (public ip) in iotdb-engine.properties. So the rpc address is the default value(0.0.0.0). Session will cache the 0.0.0.0 endpoint when an insertPlan is redirected. 
We want internal ip as private ip and rpc_address as public ip. So if the rpc_address is not set, set it the same with internal ip.

title: [To rel/0.12] Fix connection refused using session when users forget to set client ip
body:
Users only set internal ip in iotdb-cluster.properties, and they often forget to set the rpc_address (public ip) in iotdb-engine.properties. So the rpc address is the default value(0.0.0.0). Session will cache the 0.0.0.0 endpoint when an insertPlan is redirected. 
We want internal ip as private ip and rpc_address as public ip. So if the rpc_address is not set, set it the same with internal ip.

[To rel/0.12] [IOTDB-2101] Reduce the memory footprint of QueryDataSource
body:
## Description

Now, we will create QueryDataSource for each sensor in one query. QueryDataSource contains two file lists, one for seq files and another one for unseq files. This means, if we have 90,000 files and 1,000 sensors in one query, we will occupy 90,000 * 1,000 * 24B(about 2GB memory footprint) which will cause OOM problems.

However, we can let all sensors in one virtual sg share the same QueryDataSource, and save its own seq and unseq cursor in SeriesReader.

title: [IOTDB-2102] Push down limit to ReadTask in RawDataSetWithoutValueFilter
body:
If we use limit 1 while select ** from root, the sub thread is not noticed that we only need one result, so it works until the blockingQueue is filled, which wastes lots of resource.
Therefore, we push down limit to ReadTask in RawDataSetWithoutValueFilter.

title: [IOTDB-2123] Accelerate recovery process
body:
## Description

Two changes to accelerate recovery process.

1. Change the sequence of endTsFile and serialize TsFile resource. Ending Tsfile first and then serializing TsFileResource.

2. When recovering, if a TsFileResource found, do not check the TsFile.

The reason is if we find a TsFileResource, it means the TsFile is ended. Skipping check the TsFile can save a lot of time of recovery process.

title: [To rel/0.12] memory leak fix: replace RandomDeleteCache with Caffine CacheLoader as it can't limit the
body:
RandomDeleteCache can't limit its capacity by cacheSize in concurrency which caused memory leak.

Fix solution: replace with LoadingCache from Caffine for security and better performance.

title: [IoTDB-2119] IoTDB CSV export tools add timestamp accuracy setting function
[To rel/0.12] [IOTDB-2072] Remove TVListAllocator to reduce the TVList mem cost
body:
## Description

Method 2 to reduce the TVList mem cost.

After release the TVList, the empty Object array in arrayList is not trimmed but put back to the cache of TVListAllocator. If a longer TVList reused by a shorter TVList, the memory is wasted.

Therefore, removing TVListAllocator and avoid reusing the TVList is another way to reduce TVList mem cost.

title: memory leak fix: replace RandomDeleteCache with LoadingCache as its size can't limit in
body:
`RandomDeleteCache` can't limit its capacity by `cacheSize` in concurrency which caused memory leak. 

Fix solution: replace with google's `LoadingCache` for security and better performance.

title: [IOTDB-2092] Basic support aggregation query with UDF nested
body:
## Description
The task JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-2092
See the root JIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-2091

Currently I don't implement the `GROUP BY LEVEL` and `FILL` in aggregation nested by UDF query because
1. The `FILL` implementation in `GroupByFilEngineDataSet` is heavily coupled with `GroupByEngineDataSet`, it's hard to add an intermediate data layer between aggregation and fill. This feature will be implemented after decoupling `GroupByFilEngineDataSet` with `GroupByEngineDataSet`.
2. The `GROUP BY FILL` query has too many special logics, especially in the result column headers, which are inconsistent with the `ResultColumns` after logical plan optimizing. The UDTFAlignedByTimeDataSet doesn't know what the real expression of an aggregation result is in a `GROUP BY LEVEL` query(the expression will contain one or more wildcards, but the UDTF plan's expression doesn't). This feature will be implemented after optimizing AggregationExecutor.groupAggrResultByLevel by updating final result columns.
